Present Value of a Perpetuity
A perpetuity is a financial instrument that pays a fixed amount of money at set intervals
over an infinite period of time. In essence, a perpetuity is a perpetual annuity. British
consol bonds and most preferred stocks are examples of perpetuities since they promise
fixed interest or dividend payments forever. Without going into all the excruciating
mathematical details, the discount factor for a perpetuity is just one divided by the
appropriate rate of return (i.e., 1/r). Given this, we can compute the PV of a perpetuity.
